Articles.Content:
Sorry if this isn't the right place, but it's annoying the hell out of me. I'm just going to cut to the chase; I deorbited into a nearly vertical drop, then when I reached ~1000-2000 meters, I deployed my gear, causing the game to crash to the desktop. No "This Program Has Stopped Working" message. It was as if I pressed Alt+F4. It has happened on several occasions. It's not like my computer can't handle the physics or something dumb. The craft smashes into the surface just fine, but using gear, nope. Not allowed. It says it's a memory crash, but that doesn't make sense . I haven't has any other memory crashes with these mods installed. (Maybe on startup before I removed one or two)

Oh, and this only happens when I'm dropping from space, not landing a plane. B9's airbrakes do the same thing when I toggle them on in the same scenario.

Mods:

Active Texture Management

B9 Aerospace

Boulder Co

Cross Feed Enabler

Environmental Visual Enhancements

Firespitter (the .dll file)

FS Hangar Extender

Raster Prop Monitor

Kerbal Attachment System

Hyperedit

KineTech Animation

Klockheed Martian (some gimbal .dll file)

Mechjeb2

B9 Hot Rockets

ResGen(.dll)

Smokescreen(another .dll)

Spaceplane Plus

Texture Replacer

Virgin Kalactic

And now for the crash report...

error.log https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Geck64DHTrA6Fs8zDA4o9Za8dKh7KtXdXC2Ok3hpAEs/edit?usp=sharing

output_log.txt [Google Docs Won't Load This File]

Please upload the output_log somewhere that will accept it, like dropbox.

That said, according to your error log, you ran out of memory. Remove some parts from part mods (or whole mods), increase the scale of ATM, or switch to OpenGL mode.
